item.title: Mixed Earnings Momentum as 887 Companies Report Dec-2025 Quarterly Results
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has delivered a mixed bag of results across market capitalisations and sectors, with 887 companies declaring their financials. While the overall proportion of companies reporting positive results has improved to 50.0%, this marks a modest recovery from the previous quarter’s 43.0%, reflecting cautious optimism amid ongoing macroeconomic challenges. Time: 1 minute ago

item.title: Suryoday Small Finance Bank Gains 4.53%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week
item.description: Suryoday Small Finance Bank Ltd closed the week ending 30 January 2026 with a 4.53% gain, outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise over the same period. Despite a challenging start marked by a 1.77% decline on 27 January, the stock rebounded strongly in the following sessions, supported by mixed but evolving technical momentum and key fundamental developments. The week was characterised by a shift from bearish to more neutral technical signals, a downgrade in analyst ratings, and notable volume spikes, reflecting a complex market sentiment around this micro-cap banking stock. Time: 56 minutes ago

item.title: United Foodbrands Ltd’s 1.37% Weekly Gain Masks Underlying Weakness and Technical Downtrend
item.description: United Foodbrands Ltd’s stock recorded a modest weekly gain of 1.37% closing at Rs.180.75 on 30 January 2026, slightly underperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise over the same period. The week was marked by significant price swings, technical weakness, and deepening losses reported in the company’s Q3 FY26 results, reflecting ongoing operational challenges amid a volatile market backdrop. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: Suvidhaa Infoserve Ltd Declines 1.57%: 2 Key Events Mark a Challenging Week
item.description: Suvidhaa Infoserve Ltd’s stock closed the week at Rs.3.13, down 1.57% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.3.18, underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.62% over the same period. The week was marked by a sharp decline to a 52-week low and an all-time low on 29 January 2026, reflecting ongoing financial challenges and negative market sentiment despite intermittent intraday recoveries. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: Lodha Developers Gains 7.90%: 4 Key Events Shaping the Week
item.description: Lodha Developers Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 7.90% from Rs.899.85 to Rs.970.95 between 27 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The stock rebounded from a fresh 52-week low on 27 January to close near its weekly high on 30 January, supported by robust quarterly results and notable intraday price rallies amid a volatile market backdrop. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: Deep Industries Ltd Gains 8.31%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Rally
item.description: Deep Industries Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 8.31% from Rs.343.55 to Rs.372.10 between 27 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The stock’s rebound followed a challenging start marked by a 52-week low, but was supported by a shift to fair valuation and a robust intraday surge midweek. This review analyses the key events shaping the stock’s trajectory and their impact on price movements. Time: 57 minutes ago

The stock’s momentum was driven by a combination of technical shifts and a cautious upgrade in its investment rating, reflecting mixed but improving fundamentals amid ongoing sector challenges. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: G R Infraprojects Ltd Gains 4.67%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Volatility
item.description: G R Infraprojects Ltd closed the week ending 30 January 2026 with a notable gain of 4.67%, outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise over the same period. The stock’s trajectory was marked by a sharp drop to a 52-week and all-time low on 27 January, followed by a steady recovery culminating in a strong 9.11% intraday surge on the final trading day. This week’s price action reflects a mix of persistent challenges and renewed buying interest amid a subdued broader market environment. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: Eternal Ltd Gains 5.82%: 4 Key Factors Driving This Week’s Momentum
item.description: Eternal Ltd delivered a solid weekly gain of 5.82%, closing at Rs.273.70 on 30 January 2026, outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise over the same period. The stock showed notable resilience with strong volume surges and intraday highs, despite lingering technical headwinds and a recent downgrade to a Sell rating by MarketsMOJO. This review analyses the key events shaping Eternal Ltd’s price action and market sentiment during the week. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: Network People Services Technologies Ltd Falls 6.50% Amid Downgrade and 52-Week Low
item.description: Network People Services Technologies Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its stock declining 6.50% from Rs.1,295.70 to Rs.1,211.50, sharply underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.62% over the same period. The stock hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs.1,220 on 28 January 2026, coinciding with a downgrade to a Strong Sell rating by MarketsMOJO amid deteriorating financials and stretched valuation metrics. Time: 57 minutes ago

item.title: Meghmani Organics Gains 7.67%: Key Market and Financial Factors Driving the Week
item.description: Meghmani Organics Ltd rebounded strongly this week, gaining 7.67% from Rs.55.80 to Rs.60.08, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise over the same period. After hitting a 52-week and all-time low of Rs.55 on 27 January, the stock staged a recovery driven by improving financial results and positive market sentiment, despite lingering concerns over its long-term fundamentals and sector challenges. item.title: Epigral Ltd Falls 2.54% Amidst 52-Week Lows and Earnings Pressure
item.description: Epigral Ltd’s stock closed the week at Rs.1,038.70, down 2.54% from Rs.1,065.75 the previous Friday, underperforming the Sensex which gained 1.62% over the same period. The week was marked by a persistent downtrend with the stock hitting successive 52-week lows amid subdued financial results and rising interest expenses, contrasting sharply with the broader market’s positive momentum. Time: 58 minutes ago

item.title: Cartrade Tech Gains 8.27%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Rally
item.description: Cartrade Tech Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 8.27% from Rs.2,448.30 to Rs.2,650.80 between 27 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The week was marked by notable intraday volatility, a sharp profit surge in Q3 FY26 results, and a robust rally on the final trading day, underscoring a mixed but ultimately bullish sentiment for the stock amid broader market fluctuations. Time: 58 minutes ago

item.title: Acutaas Chemicals Surges 15.65% in a Week: 6 Key Drivers Behind the Rally
item.description: Acutaas Chemicals Ltd delivered a strong performance in the week ending 30 January 2026, rising 15.65% from Rs.1,651.40 to Rs.1,909.80, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The stock’s rally was fuelled by a series of positive developments including record quarterly results, new 52-week and all-time highs, and a notable upgrade in its technical and fundamental ratings. Despite a minor pullback on the final trading day, the week was marked by robust momentum and investor confidence in the Pharmaceuticals & Biotechnology sector leader. Time: 58 minutes ago

item.title: Vijaya Diagnostic Centre Ltd Falls 3.94%: 2 Key Technical Signals Drive the Week
item.description: Vijaya Diagnostic Centre Ltd experienced a challenging week, closing at Rs.956.90 on 30 Jan 2026, down 3.94% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.996.20. This decline contrasted with the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period, highlighting the stock’s underperformance amid bearish technical developments and weakening momentum signals. Time: 58 minutes ago

item.title: Paras Defence Surges 14.25% in a Week: Key Technical Shifts and Market Dynamics
item.description: Paras Defence and Space Technologies Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 14.25% from Rs.623.70 to Rs.712.60 between 27 and 30 January 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period. The stock’s rally was marked by notable intraday highs and a shift in technical momentum, reflecting a complex but predominantly positive trading environment amid broader market gains. Time: 58 minutes ago

item.title: Jainam Ferro Alloys Gains 2.93%: 2 Key Circuit Hits Define Volatile Week
item.description: Jainam Ferro Alloys (I) Ltd experienced a volatile week from 27 to 30 January 2026, marked by sharp swings between upper and lower circuit limits. The stock gained 2.93% over the week, closing at Rs.235.55, outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise. Intense buying pressure on 27 January propelled the stock to its upper circuit at Rs.240.25, followed by a steep decline hitting the lower circuit at Rs.228.25 on 28 January amid heavy selling. The subsequent sessions saw the stock stabilise, closing flat at Rs.235.55, reflecting a week of mixed sentiment and heightened volatility. Time: 58 minutes ago

item.title: Fino Payments Bank Gains 1.97%: 2 Key Factors Driving This Week’s Moves
item.description: Fino Payments Bank Ltd recorded a modest weekly gain of 1.97%, closing at Rs.217.20 on 30 January 2026, slightly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.62% rise over the same period. The week was marked by a sharp intraday rally on 28 January, followed by a cautious retreat amid mixed market signals and a quarterly earnings report that highlighted profitability pressures. This review analyses the key events driving the stock’s performance and places them in the context of broader market trends. Time: 59 minutes ago

item.title: PB Fintech Ltd Declines 1.51% Amid Rising Open Interest and Sell Rating
item.description: PB Fintech Ltd closed the week ending 30 January 2026 at Rs.1,652.80, down 1.51% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.1,678.15. This underperformance contrasted with the Sensex’s 1.62% gain over the same period, reflecting a challenging week marked by rising derivatives activity amid falling prices and a significant downgrade by MarketsMOJO. The stock’s price movements were influenced by a sharp surge in open interest on 27 January and a subsequent rating downgrade on 28 January, both of which contributed to heightened volatility and cautious sentiment among investors. Time: 59 minutes ago
